swen221.assignment1

Class LeftWalker

  • java.lang.Object
    • maze.Walker
      • swen221.assignment1.LeftWalker

  • public class LeftWalker
extends maze.Walker
    An implementation of the left walker, which you need to complete according to the specification given in the assignment handout.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LeftWalker() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean blockAhead(maze.View v)
      Checks whether the walker can continue in the same direction as it is travelling or if it is blocked
      boolean canTurnLeft(maze.View v)
      Based upon the current direction, it checks whether the walker can turn left.
      void clockWiseRotate()
      Sets the current direction by rotating clockwise based upon the current direction
      maze.Direction findLeftWall(maze.View v)
      Upon beginning the maze, we need to spin the walker around to calibrate it so that it finds a left wall to hang onto, if there is one, otherwise we move until we find one
      boolean hasAWallSurrounding(maze.View v)
      If there are no adjoining walls at all, the walker moves north (one step) and keeps searching for a left wall.
      protected maze.Direction move(maze.View v) 
      void setSquare(maze.Direction dir)
      Sets the current square that the walker is on and based on the direction parameter passed, sets the current square's exit direction to that parameter.
      void turnLeft()
      Sets the current direction by getting the left turn of the current direction.

      • findLeftWall

        public maze.Direction findLeftWall(maze.View v)
        Upon beginning the maze, we need to spin the walker around to calibrate it so that it finds a left wall to hang onto, if there is one, otherwise we move until we find one
        Parameters:
        v - View
        Returns:
        Direction

      • canTurnLeft

        public boolean canTurnLeft(maze.View v)
        Based upon the current direction, it checks whether the walker can turn left. If it can, it returns true, else, false.
        Parameters:
        v - View
        Returns:
        boolean

      • hasAWallSurrounding

        public boolean hasAWallSurrounding(maze.View v)
        If there are no adjoining walls at all, the walker moves north (one step) and keeps searching for a left wall.
        Parameters:
        v - View
        Returns:
        boolean

      • blockAhead

        public boolean blockAhead(maze.View v)
        Checks whether the walker can continue in the same direction as it is travelling or if it is blocked
        Parameters:
        v - View
        Returns:
        true

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft()
        Sets the current direction by getting the left turn of the current direction. I.E North would turn to West, East would turn to North Etc.

      • clockWiseRotate

        public void clockWiseRotate()
        Sets the current direction by rotating clockwise based upon the current direction

      • setSquare

        public void setSquare(maze.Direction dir)
        Sets the current square that the walker is on and based on the direction parameter passed, sets the current square's exit direction to that parameter. It is then added to the visited position list, or in the instance that the square has already been visited, it is re-added to the list with its new exit direction
        Parameters:
        dir - Direction
